Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the government has approved a second round of coronavirus stimulus payments.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the money will be forthcoming in "5-7 business days" when no such approval has been made.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or official announcement to back up the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that everyone who signs up will receive a second round of stimulus payments, which is not the case.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that Congress is considering another economic package, but a new round of support has not been passed yet.
